results.title: Snowbirds
results.creator_credit: Michael Brun, National Film Board of Canada and Nimbus Film Productions
results.brief_description: From cockpit to ground to sky, the camera follows the spectacular aerobatics of the Canadian Forces Air Demonstration team who control their 9.7 m long, single-engine jets as if they were extensions of their own bodies. During practice sessions, their maneuvers are videotaped for the pilots’ viewing and subsequent correction. Narrated by Alan Bleviss.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Brun, National Film Board of Canada and Nimbus Film Productions

results.title: Snow White and the seven dwarfs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David D. Hand, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: This film is regarded as a milestone in filmmaking as Walt Disney’s first full-length animated feature. Adapted from Grimm’s Fairy Tales, the film is the fairytale of Snow White, the beautiful princess whose life is threatened by the jealous Queen. Snow White finds safe haven with the seven dwarfs: Doc, Happy, Grumpy, Sleepy, Sneezy, Bashful and Dopey until a mysterious old woman arrives with a poison apple. Three years in the making, this feature propagated new developments in animation, using an unprecedented amount of man-hours in the creation of realistic movement on screen. This film is imbued in bountiful humour and music and of course striking animation. Originally billed as a children’s film, “Snow White and the seven dwarfs” is a film that from the outset had the ability to appeal across age brackets.

results.title: Soldier girls, The Leader, his driver and the driver's wife, Tracking down Maggie: The Nick Broomfield Collection Vol 2
results.brief_description: Soldier girls closely follows a group of American women recruits through a gruelling six weeks of basic training, during which time, some manage and some fail to come to terms with some of the realities that recruiting brochures never mentioned. “The Leader, his driver and the driver’s wife” Award-winning documentary shows what happens when the apparently shambolic Broomfield tries to make a film about the neo-Nazi Afrikaner Resistance movement and its leader Eugene Terre Blanche. The result is both frightening and hilarious, as Broomfield lulls his subjects into portraying themselves in their true light and deflates the pompous rhetoric by refusing to take it seriously. “Tracking down Maggie” Humorous and revealing look into the political and private worlds of former British Prime Minister, Lady Margaret Thatcher, whose lack of compliance with Broomfield aids the production.

results.title: Soldier girls
results.brief_description: Closely follows a group of American women recruits through a grueling six weeks of basic training, during which time, some manage and some fail to come to terms with some of the realities that recruiting brochures never mentioned. Closely follows the four women at Fort Gordon, Georgia through the mental and physical rigors of the camp. “Soldier Girls” was the winner of the 1981 British Film Awards’ best documentary award.
results.description: Closely follows a group of American women recruits through a grueling six weeks of basic training, during which time, some manage and some fail to come to terms with some of the realities that recruiting brochures never mentioned. results.title: Solar water heating
results.creator_credit: Roger Morse, Ted Davey, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Collecting solar energy for use in water heaters. A CSIRO scientist explains how the absorbers work and, with the aid of diagrams, how they operate on the principle of thermo-cyclic-flow. Their installation and economy are also demonstrated.

results.title: Snatch [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Guy Ritchie, Matthew Vaughn and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Guy Ritchie’s second feature follows on seamlessly from his first: the music video/caper movie, “Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels”. It’s cast - peppered with Hollywood stars Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina and Brad Pitt - portray a crowd of London small-timers torturing, mutilating and wise-cracking their way across Ritchie’s home territory: ludicrous plots, racial stereotypes and groovy pop music, all in the name of derisively good fun. If “Lock, Stock” was an escapade into guilt-free sick violence, then “Snatch” is exactly the same.

results.title: Soft fruit
results.creator_credit: Christina Andreef, Helen Bowden, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: An estranged and dysfunctional family are reunited when the matriarch of the clan is diagnosed with terminal cancer. Patsy is a stoic figure, keeping the family united, despite their fractured relationships. Patsy’s eldest daughter is a nurse, caring for her ailing mother; her other two daughters travel from Sydney and abroad with their respective children. Their brother, Bo, a biker with a history of drug abuse, is out of jail on special leave and has been disowned by his disapproving father. Vic, their father, is a disgruntled, violent figure who treats his children with disdain, whilst resenting their rallying around Patsy. The narrative is devoted to reconciliation between the disparate family members, in particular the relationship between father and son. In the spirit of black and bleak comedy, Christine Andreef’s debut feature is reminiscent of early Jane Campion work, in particular “Sweetie”; indeed “Soft fruit” has many of the hallmarks of that quirky Australian comedy. Contains scenes of great poignancy and humour, despite a certain unevenness in tenor. Cast includes Jeanie Drynan, Linal Haft, Russell Dykstra, Genevieve Lemon, Sacha Horler and Alicia Talbot.

results.title: Soccer: the universal football game
results.creator_credit: Bill Stacey, John Kingsford-Smith, Keith Lambert, Bank of New South Wales and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Instructional film on the basics of playing soccer, showing the various kicks, passes, tackles and technical skills and strategies of the game. Features the Australian Soccer Federation Team and the New South Wales Soccer Federation.

results.title: So long to run
results.creator_credit: Charles Lapp, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A woman on welfare is forced to take desperate measures to protect her children from her estranged husband and the welfare agency. The husband breaks down the door of her apartment when he suspects that she is entertaining a friend. The welfare officer threatens to remove her children if she continues to see the friend. Panic-stricken, she hides with her children in a borrowed car, but is picked up by the police.
